reference.title: Scheme map
reference.shortdesc: You define the relationships between subjects including both hierarchies and associations in the scheme map.

section.title: Description
section.p: You define a taxonomy by organizing the subjects in a hierarchy, referring to subject topics with the element.
The scheme map also expresses associations between subjects such as use of one subject by another subject. To express associations, you use the or table.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following example shows a scheme that identifies the Installing and Configuring subjects as special kinds of user action subjects. The example also identifies Security and Utilization as special kinds of user concerns.
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme title="Sample taxonomy" id="taxonomyScheme"> <subjectdef href="action.xml" navtitle="Action"> <subjectdef href="installing.xml" navtitle="Installing"/> <subjectdef href="configuring.xml" navtitle="Configuring"/> ... <subjectdef href="concern.xml" navtitle="Concern"> <subjectdef href="security.xml" navtitle="Security"/> <subjectdef href="utilization.xml" navtitle="Resource utilization"/> ...
